comments:
Fix the proliferation reduction math: your numbers imply ~51% drop (0.49 ratio), not 31%. Recompute per plate and report consistently with CIs/effect sizes.

Don’t call it “mitochondrial depletion/dysfunction” from MitoTracker alone; report “reduced MitoTracker intensity” and validate mass vs membrane potential (TOM20/COXIV or mito-GFP; MitoTracker Green; TMRM/JC-1; mtDNA copy number; OCR).

“Senescence” needs a specific marker panel: SA-β-gal, p16/p21 protein, Lamin B1 loss, SASP genes, Ki-67/EdU negative. Otherwise label as “growth arrest / low biosynthesis-like.”

Cell-cycle inference: use integrated DNA content (2N/4N) and/or an established CP cell-cycle classifier, not mean DNA intensity.

Add within-plate controls for each plate you compare (avoid one control well from a different plate). Include batch/illumination QC plots.

Do a rescue (NLRC5 re-expression or CRISPRi vs KO) to confirm on-target phenotype; ideally test a second guide if available.

Strengthen novelty/mechanism by checking profile similarity against known arrest/senescence perturbations (CDKN1A, CDKN2A, RB1, TP53, CCND1, etc.) and explicitly showing whether NLRC5 matches that cluster or is distinct.
